intro: Malacothamnus jonesii, commonly known as Jones' goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, bushy growth habit and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, often found in coastal scrub habitats. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Malacothamnus jonesii is adapted to dry, coastal climates and is an important part of the local flora in its native range.
